alert.note: Alert for Bowie (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 9:41AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Hempstead, Miller, Lafayette, southern Nevada and western Columbia Counties, northwestern Webster, northwestern Caddo and northwestern Bossier Parishes, northeastern Marion, Cass and southeastern Bowie Counties through 1030 AM CDT... At 941 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Mandeville to 6 miles northwest of Queen City to 6 miles east of Hughes Springs. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Texarkana, Magnolia, Atlanta, Wake Village, Springhill, Stamps, Waldo, Lewisville, McNeil, Vivian, Nash, Linden, Hughes Springs, Queen City, Plain Dealing, Oil City, Fouke, Bradley, Taylor and Hosston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
